newsitem.title: KENYA: Kenya shilling down on dollar after intervention.
newsitem.headline: Kenya shilling down on dollar after intervention.

text.p: The Kenyan shilling lost marginally against the dollar after a second day of central bank intervention, commercial dealers said on Thursday.
The interventions this week followed a month of central bank absence from the foreign exchange market, dealers said.
The central bank posted a commercial mean rate of 53.90 against the dollar compared to 53.89 on Wednesday, while against the pound, it was posted at a mean rate of 87.41 from 88.15.

"There are a lot inflows coming into the market and they (central bank) are the only ones buying," a dealer from a leading commercial bank told Reuters. "Actually, they are the ones holding rates at this level."
Dealers said the shilling was holding steady trading at 53.80/54 but added that the underlying tone for the shilling was still bullish -- at least for the short term.
The money market continued tight on Thursday with overnight rates quoted at 20 percent unchanged.
